timeline.message: Adding resiliency tests and relevant changes for QueueDAO.

timeline.author: apanicker-nflx

timeline.bodyText: I am not convinced that a try...catch block here is the right way to address this. The exception when terminating a workflow should be caught at a granular level within the terminate logic and this should be logged/handled accordingly.
timeline.author: apanicker-nflx

replies.bodyText: This exception is primarily for executionDAOFacade.createWorkflow(workflow), and terminateWorkflow is just a clean up as part of that exception. I'd still like to throw the exception for createWorkflow, irrespective of what happened with terminateWorkflow, while logging terminateWorkflow exception. Thoughts?
